comment.body: I like how the story about the FDA is basically that the FDA is trying to reduce it's interference in the market because big pharma profits so much from it. So they are helping us by doing less! There have been studies that show the FDA kills more people than it saves, by having a strict process for drugs that can save lives, but also in that they increase the cost of research which makes the drugs more expensive.

I feel like I have to rethink my 'User List' attempt, since all it does is update a users data.json, which if 7 users in a chat have an average of 100k data.json files and they hangout in a chat, each one is pushing 100k per 10 or so seconds, it pushes 70k per second on all the connected peers. Unless that is, ZeroNet only sends a diff/patch of the changed data.json file.

I feel like this may need a new feature in ZeroNet, allow users to demonstrate presence on a Zite if they want.

> [erkan](#comment_84_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): stuff like 4square comes to mind, e.g. I just watched this ZN site

Reddit also shows how many people are actually in a subreddit, though it doesn't actually show who is there.
